column1: back of a length at off stump, punched off the back foot into the covers
shot. Classy stuff. This is swinging away from leg stump at a length, he stays still and uses only his arms. Flicks across the line, lifts it over square leg and wide of fine leg
good comeback. Back of a length at middle stump, swings away and climbs, beats his poke away from the body
beats him again. This time the bat swings more than the ball. It's a heave across the line at this length ball that flies past the outside edge
gives him the charge, cut the swing out and lifts this back of a length ball over mid-off with a chip
good length at off stump, swings across the line and gets it off the bottom of the bat. Hit well enough to clear mid-on
back of a length outside off stump, nice bounce through, he chops it to third man with an open face
full and swinging away from off stump, clears the front leg and hammers this past extra cover
good length outside off stump, looks to hammer it on the up and is beaten on the outside edge
no slip, so that's four. He's swinging it away from a left-hander without a slip in place, so even with a good length ball in the corridor, there's no reward. Heaves on the up and gets a thick edge
oh what a shot. This is regal! Good length and at off stump, he trusts the bounce, hangs back and nails a back foot punch over mid-off
wow. Goes for his trusted slower ball. It's back of the hand and tossed up full at off stump. Long-off had just gone back but Narine has cleared the front leg and hammered it wide of that fielder
good length at off stump, straightens after pitching and gets the inside edge on his feeble defensive push, runs square into the leg side infield
bouncer, directed at his ribs, but he backs away to try and cut it over the off side. Misses out
short ball at middle stump, this time he's waiting for it. Backs away and goes over mid-on with a pull shot
goes for the yorker, misses by a long way. It's a knee-height full toss at off stump, he makes room and then uses it to lift it over point
who needs Lynn?! Geeez this is some hitting. It's a good length ball at middle stump, he offers the full face of the bat as he backs way and lifts this straight past the bowler with a high elbow
back of a length outside off, backs away and wafts at it as it angles away from him, beaten
back of a length, angled in at off stump. Goes on the back foot and punches it to deep midwicket

it works out for Raina. Drops it back of a length, slight turn away from off stump. Narine backs away, probably to his peril as he has to reach out in the end to pull this. Gets it off the bottom and he can only lift it a couple of yards behind midwicket who pedals backwards and holds on
good length at middle stump, pushes forward and adjusts for the turn to drop it into the off side
back of a length at middle stump, goes back and punches it to extra cover
back of a length at off stump, backs away to execute the cut shot, but Jadeja dives to his left at backward point to save three
good length at leg stump, goes deep in the crease and glances it to deep square leg's right
and he slides it down leg first up. No movement, just angled down leg side at a length, a slight shuffle before whipping this wide of fine leg
good length at off stump, short stride as he drives on the up to mid-on
good length, angling it at leg stump. Climbs into it and flicks to deep square leg
full and wide outside off stump, he doesn't move his feet too much but there's enough width for him to extend his arms and tap it on the up, wide of extra cover
back of a length outside off stump, drives on the up to extra cover
full at middle stump, flicked to deep square leg
back of a length, angled in at off stump, goes deep in the crease and punches it to long-on

miscued pull shot and Finch goes McCullum at the long-on boundary. This is dropped short at off stump, hurries him on the pull shot and the gets it wide off long-on where Finch puts in a one-handed dive but drops it
good length, angled in at middle stump, tucked into the leg side off the back foot
good length at middle stump, gets on one knee and sweeps this on the up, gets enough to hit get it fine of deep square leg
good length at off stump, looks to turn it into the leg side, inside edge onto boot
full at middle stump, just about gets bat on this with his sweep. It was too full to sweep. Gets an inside edge to deep square leg
good length, tossed up outside off stump. Doesn't get to the pitch as he pushes at this. Thick outside edge to short third man
tossed up full outside off stump from around the wicket, driven down to long-off
tossed up outside off stump, offers the full face as he pushes to long-off
back of a length outside off stump, leans in and turns it on the up to deep midwicket
back of a length, spinning away from off stump, but he goes on the back foot and closes the face to turn this into the leg side
awkward. Arm ball fired across the left-hander at a good length, he steps out to tuck it into the leg side, gets a leading edge that rolls to sweeper cover
back of a length at off stump, opens the face and chops it wide of point go runs to his right and cuts it off
back of a length, cuts in sharply from outside off stump and cramps him up as he looks to run it down to third man. He gets it wide of the keeper off the glove
good length at middle stump, flicks it to midwicket's left
back of a length at off stump, gets behind the line and drops it into the off side off the back foot with soft hands
bouncer at middle stump, it's too short. Flies well above his attempted hook
full off cutter at off stump, gets leg side of it and slices to sweeper cover
good length outside off stump, he walks at it and looks to slap it across the line. It nips back in and beats his inside edge
good length, fired flat and across off stump, he gives him the charge and skews his inside-out shot, but it lands short of Baz at long-on
low full toss, fired in fast, catches him on the boot on the full as he looks to reverse sweep. But it struck him outside the line and the appeal is turned down
tossed up at off stump, a small stride in before unleashing a nice old-fashioned slog to clear deep midwicket
back of a length at off stump, dabs it square into the off side off the back foot
good length at off stump, comes back in after pitching and gets the inside edge on his tentative forward push
good length at middle stump, a stride down the pitch to flick it into the leg side
back of a length at middle stump, climbs on him and hits him in the chest as he looks to glance this square into the leg side

Jadeja backs his throw and gives away four overthrows. This is short and wide, he mistimes the cut and it bounces towards Jadeja at point. Uthappa is halfway down the track but Gambhir is sending him back. He expects the throw to be at the other end is lazing back towards his crease. Jadeja throws at the strikers stumps and isses
steps out, can't connect properly on this attemped inside-out drive, chipped to long-off
back of a length at off stump, gets deep in the crease and gracefully pulls it to deep midwicket
back of a length outside off stump, dabbed to third man off the back foot
full at off stump, driven down the ground, straight to long-off
shot. Back of a length at off stump, this hasn't climbed at all but Uthappa has somehow got under this and pull it right off the middle to clear deep midwicket
full and angled in at leg stump, driven to long-on
back of a length, offcutter, picks it, waits for it and drops it to point with an open face
lovely. This offcutter is dropped short and wide of off stump, Uthappa is all balance as he executes this late cut to perfection to get it wide of short third man
overpitched outside off stump, his eyes light up, but his hands have hardened and he's looking to smoke this cover drive. Can only get it to roll past the bowler off the inside half of the bat
back of a length at middle stump, cramped for room, defends off the back foot
he's on song, this guy. This is back of a length, angled across off stump. Shapes to cut and then opens the face at the very last minute to get this late cut past the keeper
good length, angled across off stump, leans in and defends it to point

top edge is taken at midwicket. This is a good length ball that climbs up on him as he goes deep and looks to swat into the leg side. The top edge goes a few million miles in the air - Raina has enough time to check for his footing as he tries to get under it. Adjusts and looks up, finds himself right under it and pouches safely
good length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
good length outside off stump, goes across the line to find that deep midwicket boundary again, beaten as this slides under his angled bat

gets the pull off the sticker but he is safe. This is back of a length and close to his body. Uthappa goes with that favourite hoick over midwicket again, but he's hurried on this. It lobs gently but is well wide and in front of long-on
good length, angled into the pads. Stays put and tickles it fine. Long leg has to run a long way to his right to cut this off
full at off stump, driven to long-off

oh, close. Arm ball is fired fast, back of a length at off stump. He's looking to chop this behind third man with a late cut. Gets an inside edge that bounces narrowly wide of off stump and into the keeper
good length at leg stump, pushed with soft hands to long-on
arm ball, good length at leg stump, puts in a stride and flicks it to long leg
short ball outside off stump, tries to place this between short third man and backward point, can't get enough connection on it
back of a length at leg stump, pushes it to deep square on the up and comes back for the second despite a bullet throw
good length at middle stump, pushes it into the leg side again on the up

lovely shot. This looks so innocuous at first, but he has timed it brilliantly. Back of a length at middle stump, he gets off his toes and tucks this off his hips. Looks to be a nudge for one but this has raced past short fine
back of a length at off stump, drops it into the off side off the back foot

back of a length, angled away from off stump. Slogs across the line and cops this on the back thigh pad. There's a loud appeal but this hit him outside the line and it wouldn't have hit the stumps anyway
good length at off stump, opens the face to push it to the left of extra cover
good length at leg stump, short stride, pushes it to midwicket
uff how did that miss the stump? Arm ball, good length, beats his attempted drive on the up, and also misses the off stump
good length at middle stump, goes across the line and chips one in front of long-on
he has monopolized that area behind the keeper. Back of a length outside off stump, stays deep, waits a bit and opens the face to hit it fine
and again. This is good length, angled in at middle stump, walks across the stumps and lifts it over the keeper with a ramp to bring up his fifty
short and wide, goes for the conventional cut shot, finds backward point
full at off stump, backs away to find the gaps in the off side, but bunts it straight to extra cover
yorker at leg stump, just about brings down his bat to squeeze this to short fine leg
full toss, tailing into his pads, and he shovels across the line to get it fine
back of the hand slower ball, full toss at middle stump. He hasn't picked this. Through the attempted sweep shot early. Gets a leading edge into his grille and is safe
full at off stump, looks to hit this inside-out over extra cover, miscues and finds long-off on the bounce
low full toss at middle stump, looks to bludgeon this across the line, bat turns in his hands and he can only drag it wide of long-on
slower ball, looped full at leg stump. He walks into the off side to try and find the gap behind square on the leg side. It tickles through to the keeper via his pad
slower ball, full at leg stump again. This time he gets low and ramps it high between keeper and short fine. They team up to clean up after giving chase
full ball at middle stump, this is right under his eye. He's shaped as if he wants to hit into the leg side, but only manages to lift this straight and on the bounce to long-off
slower ball, good length outside off stump, spins away from him and he has to reach out to find sweeper cover with a drive on the up
yorker at off stump, digs it out and pushes it in front of extra cover
full slower ball outside off stump, he winds up with front foot out of the way to try and slog this, it slides through from under his shot
gorgeous shot. Overpitched at off stump, brings down his big backlift on this and meets it on the pitch. Then uses his bottom hands to turn this wide of long-off. One bounce and four
misses the slower ball by a big margin and he's sent into the stands. Back of the hand ball, nice and juicily offered as a middle stump full toss. He waits and clobbers this over deep midwicket

This is a yorker at leg stump that hits Uthappa on the back leg. Umpire Nitin Menon says that's not out but replays show that was plumb. Uthappa was looking to flick this behind square and was beaten by pace
full at middle stump, flicked into the leg side, finds deep square
full toss at middle stump, looking to hit it too hard, gets an inside edge onto his boot that rolls into the leg side through the midwicket region
yorker at leg stump, perfectly executed. He can only lift his back leg and awkwardly squeeze this to short fine leg
yorker at middle stump from around the wicket, gets the slog off the toe-end, single to long-on
full at middle stump, he looks to hit against the angle over midwicket, gets a leading edge that hangs up nicely for McCullum at long-on and he takes it comfortably
nails the yorker at off stump, he can't do much about this, jams it out into the leg side
overpitched at off stump, thumped past the non-striker, straight at long-off...where Finch takes his eyes off the ball and fumbles to leak an extra run
full, just outside off stump. He hasn't got this off the middle, but he has done enough with the wrists to lift this wide of Finch at long-off, and that's a safe shot in the end

low full toss at middle stump. Once more, he hasn't connected too well, but he has picked the gap perfectly. His field is set for the ball angling away from off stump, and so there's no protection at deep square leg. That's where Yusuf flicks it. Good batting.
superb bowling. See him try to make room, follows him and gets the yorker to land right next to his toe. He can't get bat on this
hangs deep in the crease, gets a full toss at off stump, uses the room to slash this through point and find the boundary
gone. Thampi gets his man in the end. Had him struggling all through with that yorker and he beats him this time. Takes out off stump with a deflection off the pads
brave shot, but only one. This is another yorker, tailing in at leg stump, he goes for the reverse sweep but can't connect. Hits it straight to short third man

yorker at off stump, hammered back past the bowler, straight to long-off. Yadav was looking to come back fot the second, but Yusuf had his back turned to the fielder. Poor running technique. He doesn't respond to his partner either. McCullum lobs it to the strikers end where Karthik collects it a little wide of the pitch, takes a a stride to his right and breaks the stumps with an over-arm throw before Yadav can return from his trip to halfway-down
slower ball, yorker length, wide of off stump. He can only slice this to backward point with no timing
short of a length, Finch is backing away and slaps it out to covers
sliding in with the arm, Finch backs away and tries to loft it, gets it off the inside part of the bat to deep midwicket
that's a powerful strike down the ground. Flighted, on the stumps from Shakib, McCullum drills and drills it hard straight over the bowler's head
backs away early and Shakib offers up width outside off to try and take it away from him. McCullum moves back across and frees his arms, gets towards it and crunches it through covers
pitched up, on the stumps, defended back to the bowler
short of good length, sliding in to the batsman, punched to extra cover
shortish from Narine, not much turn, Finch swivels around and pulls to deep square leg
backs away to make room for this length ball and heaves it over the in-field off the backfoot. Clean over the covers, punched over extra cover
and again, backs away but this time the bowler follows him, Finch tries to tuck it but wears it on the pad
over cow corner this time. Gets down and slog sweeps powerfully. Pitched up, pitching outside off and coming into him, smacked with the turn
fullish and sliding in with the arm, tries to go over long-on but does not get the elevation, along the ground to long-on

gets down to sweep and the ball is not full enough, gets hit on the pad and there is an optimistic appeal from Uthappa. Shakib does not bother going up. He was hit outside all three stumps, down the leg side
gives it a little air but it is not short enough, Finch rocks back and shovels it between long-on and deep midwicket
tries to cut but not enough room and he inside-edges it to the pad
rocks on to the backfoot, back of a length, whips it uppishly over mid-on
that's huge. Pitched up, too full to do anything. Finch gets on top of the bounce and lofts it clean and high straight down the ground
offers up some width outside off and McCullum drops it square of the wicket on the off side for a single
backs away and looks to heave it over the leg side but the ball shapes into him and he misses. The bowler has overstepped
well-done. Slower bouncer, Finch is through with the pull early and makes no contact

gets slightly big on him and this time he makes contact on the pull. But unlike the previous bouncer, this one is not slow, comes on quickly to him and catches Finch by surprise. He does not find the middle of the bat and holes out to deep square leg
short of a length, outside off, and quick hands from McCullum. Plays a late square cut and beats the diving fielder at point. Struck extremely hard
gets it off the top part of the bat but still goes all the way. Another quick bouncer from Coulter-Nile, get sbig on McCullum who swings hard on the pull and dispatches it over deep square leg
backs away and Coulter-Nile fires it quick and wide outside off, McCullum throws everything at it, gets a thick outside edge that goes through square third man
short of a length, spinning away, Raina swivels around and mistimes the pull between midwicket and mid-on
on a length, sliding in on leg, McCullum waits for it and turns it away into the leg side for one
fired quick at 100kph, was there an edge. Draws Raina forward, on a length and spinning away from him. Gets the outside edge and kisses the glove of Uthappa going away. Came on very quickly to him
full, pushed down to long-off for one
ooh, uppish from McCullum but through the gap. Backs away to this length ball and pushes it through the off side. Chips it in the air but he gets it away between cover and extra cover for a couple
good length, tucked with the turn to midwicket
gives it too much air, outside off, full toss, driven down to wide long-off
short of a length, fired in on leg stump, Raina gets down on one knee and looks to pull it away but gets it away off the pad to fine leg
full, on the pads, pushed down to long-on
backs away and the bowler follows him, sliding in with the arm on leg, McCullum sees the full length and gets down to sweep through backward square leg
another powerful sweep, full again, on middle and leg, played out to deep square leg this time
flat, on a length, tucked off the hips to square leg
full, on off, pushed to mid-off and takes off for a quick single, the fielder there fumbles as he tries to pick it up

holes out to sweeper cover. McCullum backs away and lofts this over the off side. Good, pacy delivery from Woakes, at 140 kph, on the stumps, McCullum flays it but straight into the hands of Manish Pandey who snaffles it reverse-cupped
fuller ball, drops the pace, 124 kph, clipped off the pads uppishly through midwicket
short of a length, angling into him, tucked off the pads through midwicket for one
short of a length, waits for it before pulling it with caution to square leg
short, wide, slapped off the backfoot, beats point diving to his left
full, on the pads, tucked off the pads and beats midwicket diving to his left. They come back for two as the ball is fielded at the deep

leading edge, taken. That's a smart catch by Gambhir at covers. Karthik perishes trying to play across the line. Tries to make use of the wrists and flicks it from outside off, closes the face of his bat early, it just straightened from the good length region. Gambhir dives to his left to snaffle it
short of a length, fired wide of the crease and angling in outside off, punched ti wide long-on for one
short of a length, pushed across outside off, Raina dabs it away through backward point with an open bat face
short of good length, angling in outside off, pushes Kishan back with pace, 142 kph, and the batsman punches it off the backfoot  square of the wicket on the off side
fuller, angling in on of, slower ball from Coulter-Nile, it was the cutter and Kishan keeps it out off the front foot
on a length and pushed across, Raina backs away and heaves it away through extra cover, beats sweeper cover running to his left
dropped. Yusuf, running to his right from deep fine leg, stretches out his right hand but it bursts through the hand and over the boundary. Short, pitching on leg and Raina swivels around and pulls
short of good length, pulled away to deep midwicket for one

and now Kishan tries to do a repeat of Raina's earlier shot. It is closer this time and he makes no contact on the pull. Appeal for caught behind but not given. It was down the leg side but not given a wide, must have brushed some part of the body
dabs it between cover and point for a quick single
on the pads, whipped away to deep midwicket for one
flighted on leg, drilled down to wide long-on for a single
slightly short of a length and some width on offer, Kishan slaps it away to deep point
and again, some width on offer as it spins away but Raina finds point on the cut
very full, on middle and leg, pushed down to long-on
great delivery, on a length and gripping the surface as it sharply turns away, beats the outside edge of Kishan who is drawn forward
short and spinning away, looks to cut but it stops on him, he mistimes it to cover-point
on a length and spinning away, cut to sweeper cover
good length ball, turning away and this time it is pulled against the turn to long-on
good shot. Backs himself to go over extra cover and times to superbly. Pitched up, right in the slot and enough width for Raina to free his arms
good length, tucked off the pads to the left of the bowler, denies the single as Kishan is looking for it
slightly short of a length, uses the depth of his crease to shift back and swats it away through backward square leg
full, outside off, driven down to long-off

poor effort from Narine. Spinning away from Raina who just opens the face of his bat to steer it through third man. Sunil Narine is at short third man, just jogs across and escorts the ball to the boundary, needed a dive
thinks of coming down the track but doesn't, on a length and spinning away, stabbed into the off side

sliding in with the arm on leg, Kishan gets down to sweep and does not keep it down. He had to go for it, the dots were piling, does not get it as fine as he would have liked, holes out to Umesh, who is in the deep, just backward of square leg
gets down for a slog sweep first ball and makes sweet connection, Gets it up and over midwicket and through the boundary, beats the man running across in the deep
fullish, gets down to sweep but it is the googly and spins away from him, not picked by Smith who cannot put bat to ball
short of a length, tucked off the hips through backward square leg for one
fuller, outside off, rolls his fingers over it, swats it away to deep midwicket
short of good length, moves across and tucks it off the pads to deep fine leg
bowled him, Umesh strikes in his first over and Smith is gone. Full, on off and middle, swings back in late to find the inside edge of Smith, bottom of the bat, off the toe end and into the stumps
short of a length, angled across, gets on top of the bounce and opens the face of his bat to run it down to third man
short of a length, whipped off the hips to deep backward square leg
fullish length, spinning away, stabs it out through covers for one
good length, spinning away, slapped out to sweeper cover
flights it up nicely and draws Raina forward. He checks his push and chips it in the air, on the bounce to long-on, there is no fielder inside the circle there
full, on the pads, wrong'un from Kuldeep, swept away to deep midwicket
inside-edge, narrowly misses the stumps. That was a superb delivery. Skididng on straight with the arm and Raina is drawn forward and plays for the turn, gets an inside edge away to fine leg
worked down to long-off off the front foot. And that is fifty for Raina
slog sweep, clean over deep midwicket. It was the slower ball from Umesh, fullish length and in the slot for Raina, launches it into the stands
short of good length, Raina tries to flick it away and wears it on the pad, away to square leg
short of a length, on the stumps, whipped off the pads to wide long-on
inside edge, misses the stumps by a whisker. Raina tries to punch off the backfoot through the off side but is slightly cramped for room
short and wide, leans across to reach out for it and slaps it late, beats backward point diving to his right
short of a length and angled across again, Raina opens the face of his bat and this time does not hit it hard, just uses the pace to steer it wide of square third man
spinning away outside off, stabs it in front of point
flighted and turn outside off, played with soft hands straight to point
short of good length, punched off the backfoot to point again, still can't find the gap
back of a length, does not turn much so it does not give him much room, Jadeja knocks it to the left of the bowler who gathers it cleanly

great catch by Suryakumar Yadav. But, hang on. The fielder says it's six. Takes the catch right in front of the boundary, sees himself going back with the momentum, so he throws the ball in the air, comes back out and completes the catch. But he had stepped on the ropes as he took the catch the first time. It was full, outside off and Jadeja fetched a slog sweep from outside off. Timely six for Lions
short of good length, pulled away to deep midwicket and they come back for the second
goes from close to the bowler but gets past him for four. Backs away to this back of a length ball and shovels it to the right of the bowler
short of a length, backs away and swings and gets beaten outside off
lovely shot. That's a tremendous strike. Raina backs away and this is full and just outside off. Jams the bat down and opens the face of his bat to squeeze it out through backward point
this is tremendous striking either side of the wicket. Full, on off, Raina walks across, picks it up off the pads and clips it uppishly over deep square leg
full, outside off, opens the face of his bat again but this time squirts it out finer to third man for a single
goes for a yorker and ends up bowling a full toss that is punched out between cover and mid-off, cover runs to his left and cuts it off and they take one
flighted, outside off, Jadeja tries to heave it over the leg side but does not make great connection, along the ground to long-on
backs away to this slightly shortish ball and stabs it to the left of point
pitched up and sliding on the pads, turned away to the left of the bowler, towards mid-on and Kuldeep runs across and fields it
slog sweep, six. Pitched up, outside leg and spinning away, Raina gets the front leg out of the way and thumps it over deep midwicket. Against the turn but effective.

too close to cut and Kuldeep gets some extra bounce. Raina cannot completely free his arms as he looks to slap it away and ends up chipping it to Manish Pandey who runs to his left from point and takes the catch

is that a run out? They go upstairs to check. This was pitched up, outside leg and Faulkner trickles it down to fine leg. Man from the deep backward square leg boundary has to run across and they take him on for a third run. Jadeja is a bit lazy in completing the third run, not as quick and the throw comes in at the keeper's end, he whips the bails off but Jadeja has made it back
very full outside off, backs away and squeezes it out to third man. Just four required now.
short of good length, angled across, Jadeja sees the room, opens up his arms and steers it through point for a four. And that is the game
